text.author: Agence France-Presse; Guardian staff reporter
text.description: Former Italian prime minister appealed against initial award of €3m a month to former wife Veronica Lario
text.title: Italian court orders Berlusconi to pay €1.4m a month in alimony

main.p: The former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi has been ordered to pay his former wife €1.4m (£1m) a month in alimony as part of a divorce settlement, Italian media reported.
Veronica Lario, 58, was married to the billionaire media magnate and politician for nearly 25 years before divorcing him in 2014. She was initially awarded an allowance of €3m a month.
Berlusconi, 78, appealed against the amount and a court in Monza, near Milan, ruled on Tuesday that he would have to pay her €1.4m.

The two separated in 2009 after Berlusconi was embroiled in a scandal over his participation in the birthday party of 18-year-old Noemi Letizia. Lario told the press that she “could not stay with a man who associates with minors”.

In 2011, Berlusconi was accused of paying exotic dancer Karima El-Mahroug for sex when she was underage at “bunga bunga” parties at his villa in Milan. He was convicted in 2013 but was cleared this year.
